data.text: @EMSTStudies @Citizen_Case "Let the girl get help." Exactly, let people get help to the degree they need it.

@nobodysbabynow1 It was a brave decision on her part and I commend her for it. Anyone seeking help is being strong in actively seeking it, voicing it, facing it to move forward. I the 21st century seeing it otherwise is just Neolithic. I hope she’s now on the road to recovery <3

@nobodysbabynow1 I mean she is not only stressed about her career but her health also! People don't realise how lupus works. Your body is basically fighting itself and I am pretty sure kidney transplant isn't am easy thing to go with. I am glad she is getting help instead did pushing it down

@nobodysbabynow1 God people are fucking douchebags! She is dealing with not only the pressure of being in the public eye but lupus and kidney transplant! Do they even realise how difficult it is to live with the disease. I am barely able to go to work! This girl is badass. It's okay to get help.
@JPB_Weebs I'm really sorry you had to go through that. And yes, we need people to realize these are real health issues, as serious as a broken arm or any other kind of injury.

@nobodysbabynow1 What the hell is wrong with people? I’ve suffered from depression twice, my brother committed suicide....why can’t people realize how insensitive and wrong they are? We need more mental health awareness....

@XKissYourFaceX @Citizen_Case That's another thing. People get all high and mighty online, and the moment they step outside and someone confronts them they shrink and deny. It's like dealing with children.

@Citizen_Case @nobodysbabynow1 People are insensitive assholes, particularly strong behind the veil of a keyboard and computer screen. This is something I'd take zero issue in saying to someones face.
@Citizen_Case GOD, literally yes. People really don't think twice about what comes out of their mouths.

@nobodysbabynow1 A celebrity commits suicide: “I don’t get it. They have the time and resources to get the best help possible. Why?”
A celebrity checks themselves into a facility: “Lol, what happened, Princess? Starbucks mess up your order?”

There's a medical history there, there's a doctor who decided it's better she spends a couple of days there. She didn't decided to go in just for shits and giggles.

It's a big deal, and it's real. Don't be a fucking asshole.

This isn't her being sad about an ex not texting back, this isn't her getting upset about a bad haircut.

This is her struggling with her mental health to the point she has to be in a hospital.
